definition: to cry (of birds, animals and insects)/to make a sound/to voice (one's gratitude, grievance etc)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理学家们对自己的学科都颇为自鸣得意。

sentences.english: Thus the fool, as compared with the scoundrel, is invariably self-complacent.
sentences.chinese: 所以同恶棍相比，蠢人总是自鸣得意。

sentences.english: Here we are in danger of smugly supposing superiority.
sentences.chinese: 自我感觉优越并自鸣得意，这样的假设是很危险的。

sentences.english: When Arivama was getting smug over it Kira thanked him.
sentences.chinese: 正当他自鸣得意时，吉良开始感谢他。

sentences.english: They will clap themselves for gaining tuppence and giving a million away to their enemies.
sentences.chinese: 却把一百万都输了给敌人，还会为此而自鸣得意呢。

sentences.english: A stark word of warning for self-satisfied designers everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 这是对那些自鸣得意的设计者的警告。

sentences.english: But this is no time for complacency.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有时间自鸣得意。

sentences.english: They get lazy, complacent, and self-satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 他们变的懒惰，自满，自鸣得意。

sentences.english: He is always proud of his so called refinement in manners.
sentences.chinese: 他总是为他所谓的高雅举止自鸣得意。

sentences.english: Nor can the rest of the world look on smugly at Europe’s woes.
sentences.chinese: 世界其它国家也不能看着欧洲的灾难而自鸣得意。

sentences.english: The smug guy with the beer and the cigarette?
sentences.chinese: 那些拿着啤酒香烟的自鸣得意的家伙呢？

sentences.english: Medea flees the scene, smug in the success of her deception.
sentences.chinese: 而美狄亚为着自己成功的骗术而自鸣得意着逃离了。

sentences.english: He always says something with cock-a-hoop.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时经常一副自鸣得意的样子。

sentences.english: Nationalism is a silly cock crow on it own dunghill.
sentences.chinese: 民族主义，是在自己的小天地里自鸣得意的雄鸡。

sentences.english: He is always proud of his so-called refinement in manners.
sentences.chinese: 他总是为他所谓有高雅举止自鸣得意。

sentences.english: The problem with most compa-nies is complacency.
sentences.chinese: 自鸣得意是大多数公司的通病。

definition: to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
variant of 得意洋洋[de2 yi4 yang2 yang2]
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
